summary: The U.S. Victims of State Sponsored Terrorism Fund was established in 2015 to compensate people injured in acts of international state-sponsored terrorism. It allocated about $3.3 billion in payments across three rounds—in 2017, 2019, and 2020. Certain 9/11 victims, spouses, and dependents became eligible for the Fund in 2019. Legislation in 2020 required us to estimate the amount of "catch-up" payments—lump sums for newly eligible...
title: U.S. Victims of State Sponsored Terrorism Fund: Estimated Lump Sum Catch-Up Payments
